Quote.Speaker: Hotel Employee
Quote.Text: [on phone] Vancouver Court Hotel, how many I help you?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hello Vancouver, this is Michael Scott calling from the United States of America! I have a reservation in your fair city from February 12th to the 19th, first week of the Olympics.

Quote.Speaker: Hotel Employee
Quote.Text: Well, we are looking forward to having you, so, let me just pull up your information here...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okey doke.

Quote.Speaker: Hotel Employee
Quote.Text: Um, I don't seem to have it, sir.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [looking through Michael's email] I'm not seeing anything under "confirmation."

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Could it be under "affirmation?" Cause you have thousands of those.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. [to hotel employee on phone] We're trying to look it up right now.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You [i]did[/i] get the e-vite to my barbeque!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Um, come on.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael...

Quote.Speaker: Hotel Employee
Quote.Text: Uh, sir? A lot of people are trying to get last-minute reservations at hotels here for the Olympics, but we've been fully booked for months.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, I have been booked for three years, so you should have that. I've always heard that British Columbia is a very nice place, but I am not getting that from this conversation.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wait, I got it! Confirmation code:

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Today, Jo Bennett, the CEO from Sabre, is coming to see us here for the first time. She bought us sight unseen, like a mail-order bride, so she's gotta be kinda nervous. I mean, are we ugly? Are we smart? Are we cool? Are we too cool? Do we speak English?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [Jo Bennett enters with two humongous dogs, everyone stands to welcome her except Dwight] Why hello!

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: This is Michael Scott, co-regional manager of this branch.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pleasure to meet you, Miss Bennett.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Oh, that's Mrs. Bennett, sweetheart. My husband and I are divorced, but I kept the "Mrs." just to piss off the new wife. Well, let's take a gander around this place.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [Jo's dogs are sniffing at his crotch] These sure are pretty dogs...

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: They love a good crotch.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: They sure do.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: You should take that as a compliment!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, I do!

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: [to Dwight] Hello.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hello.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Do you always stay seated when a lady enters the room?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I am treating you the same as a man, for whom I would also not stand. Unless it was the President. Or Judge Judy.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: I like that.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: This is Accounting.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Hi!

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Good-looking group.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Over here is Meredith Palmer and Creed Bratton.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Another couple of heartbreakers. Who is this tall drink of sun tea?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: That is Jim Halpert, he is the co-regional manager of this office.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: [gesturing to Michael] I thought this guy was the manager?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Oh, he is. He's the co-manager, and that's the other co-manager.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Two guys doing one job? We gotta do something about that!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Got some Valentine's cards for my coworkers and my bro-workers.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [as Andy is passing her a card] No, no!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: What, no candy?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Valentine's Day, right around the corner. Erin and I have been on zero dates. So I got her a Valentine's Day card, but I didn't wanna seem "too eager," so I got cards for everyone in the whole office to kind of dilute it a little bit.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [throwing a card at Meredith, which skims her throat]:

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Yeah, I have this thing about men cutting or threatening to cut my throat. Don't try to cut my throat.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Jo, I don't know how things work in Florida, which from your description sounds like a colorful, lawless swamp, but here it takes two men to do one job, where in Florida it might take one very strong woman to do such a job.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Whoa, whoa.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Whoa, whoa!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'll take over. Um, what we're doing here:

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: I'm Jolene Bennett, Jo for short. I'm a breast cancer survivor, close, personal friends with Nancy Pelosi, and Truman Capote and I slept with three of the same guys. When I was a little girl, I was terrified to fly, and now I have my own pilot's license. I am CEO of Sabre International, and I sell the best damn printers and all-in-one machines Korea can make. Pleased to meet you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [almost running into Erin] Whoa-oh, traffic jam!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Uh-oh, traffic jam on route three!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [imitating car noises] Beep-beep! Beeooop-beep!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Beep! Twenty people dead in a pile-up!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: There's blood everywhere! Um, I got you a Valentine's card.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [opening card] Oh, you did? Aw, a bird and a dog!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, well it's Snoopy and Woodstock.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: You named them?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Uh, Charles Schultz did. I thought it was relevant cause I got you all those birds for Christmas, remember?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Uh, yeah I do remember. [reading card] Aw, they love each other.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, look at that. They sure do. I hadn't noticed.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Wow, it smells really good too.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah! It's Roger Federer for men, I sprayed some in there.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Andy, whoa! Thank you very much!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: It's got pheromones in it.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Hey!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: [to Angela, who's having a hard time deciding on a chair] Just choosing seats, not getting married. Chop, chop little onion!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Jo, there's books in my chair.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: That's right, darlin', now you're the proud new owner of a Sabre handbook and my autobiography. Now, you all must be in a tizzy. I can see it on your faces, I mean, what's going on now? I mean, who owns Dunder Mifflin? Right? I mean, Sabre? What's that? Some company I've never heard of? Down in Tallahassee? Where is that? Near Mars?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, we know. Texas!

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Now Dunder Mifflin has an arm's reach in all these small businesses all over the northeast. Now we're gonna take that arm, and we're gonna start selling printers.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I could manage my way around that.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: They're the easiest-to-use printers on the market.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I will try to manage my excitement!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I have been saying the word "manager" a lot, so whenever Jo thinks "manager" she thinks of me. Camel cigarettes did the same thing with Joe Camel by making him look like a penis. I can't even go near a cigarette now without thinking of a penis. And vise-versa.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: I think that's it. So we're all good! [many employees raise their hands] Thanks ya'll.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [Jo leaves] I, uh...

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [reading her Valentine's card from Andy] Oh my God.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I guess Andy likes me. I never thought of him in that way. But, I guess in most romantic comedies, the guy you're supposed to be with is the one you never thought of in that way. You might have even thought he was annoying or possibly homosexual.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So, check this out. According to the handbook, you could make more money as a salesman than as a manager. They have all these incentive programs. I ran your numbers from last year.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: This is way more than I make now.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I don't think I'm gonna miss being manager. You know how some people say they're not in it for the money? Well, with all due respect to this job, I think I'm definitely in it for the money. And quite honestly, the women.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, you got a second?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Sure. You here to tell me that you think I would be a better manager and that you are sorry for being such a jerk?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Actually, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Exactly that. I think that you absolutely deserve the manager position more than I do.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What? Really?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wow!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: La la la, hello Oscar!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Michael. Reading.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What are you reading?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: The Atlantic.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, that is my favorite ocean! I love it! I am so happy right now. No! I can't keep it a secret any longer. Jim is stepping down to salesman, I am going to be the sole manager once again.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I should step into sales myself.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why, is there an untapped gay market?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Sabre has no caps on commissions. He can make a lot more money in sales.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ...Where did you get that information.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Manual.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Manuel who?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, according to the manual, there is no cap on commissions. I have been hustled.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Son of a bitch. [enters conference room] Pardon me.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Oh, speak of the devil. We were just talking about you. Have a seat!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Now Jim here is thinking about taking himself out of the running for being manager.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Really? Aw, that is so sweet of you! But, I cannot accept, because I have been thinking about it, and I think I wanna go back to sales.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Really.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah. You can take the man out of the salesman, but you can't take the sales out of salesman.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Well, I think you're both being a little too modest.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, I really, really think Michael is better at being manager for so many reasons.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, I think I would be bad. I would sleep in my office, and I would sexually harass people.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Why would you do that?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm turning myself in right now!

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: You know, Michael, you have more experience in sales and management, so I'm gonna defer to your judgment.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: I think you [to Michael] will become the salesman, and congratulations! [to Jim] You're gonna be the new manager of this branch!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Great! That's great. Congratulations. Have fun signing my commission checks, boss.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [pointing to the window in Michael's office] Oh, Michael marked his heights. He's grown!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Mm!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [on phone] Bobcat, this is Dragon. Listen. He's been promoted to sole manager. We've got to step this up. Meet me behind the dumpster in ninety seconds. [hangs up phone] 89... 88...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You're twenty minutes late!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [walking up] Um, I was at another dumpster!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Just admit you lost track of time.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ryan and I have been meeting up to work on our diabolical plot against Jim. Ryan is always late for our meetings. I wish I had a lair.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Did you see Saw?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Of course I seesaw. Mose and I seesaw all the time.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: No, uh, the movie. Did you see the movie Saw?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah. Great film. Almost as fun as going on a seesaw.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Okay, the reason these movies are so popular, is the element of psychological torment.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I like where you're going with this. Continue.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Could we lure him into an old warehouse or something?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I have an old barn!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's kinda smelly, but that might be a plus! And then what?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: We do what they did in Saw! ... I mean, we don't kill him, obviously. I have a mask...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, that's your idea? Exactly like in the movie!? That is the most idiotic thing I have ever heard in my life!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Well suggest something else then! Don't just...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: He's supposed to cut his leg off? Think!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Don't just criticize my idea!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Think!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: You think of something then!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Michael, I'm worried that, uh, not all your toys are gonna fit on your new desk.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: How is that possible?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Well, in your old office there were all those ledges and extra space.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No excuses Erin, come on! Make it happen.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: You know, I actually think I should get back to work. Jim asked me to do some stuff, and he's manager.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah. Fine, fine. Leave it here. I have to make some sales anyway. Who should I call with my magic sales fingers? [Michael's phone rings] Michael Scott, head of sales.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [on phone] You gotta do something, man. You can't just sit there.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: The new IT guy. Nick.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Nick.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I think he is the key. He's very trusting, he's looking for friends, he has been given an awesome amount of power, and does not know how to wield it.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Like Frodo!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Why don't you just let me handle the Tolkien references, okay dumb jock?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Well, I think he can be corrupted. Like Gollum.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Smeagol was corrupted and became Gollum.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I might start a diabolical plot against him after this one.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Who's hungry?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What is that?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: It's ants on a log. Michael would always have me bring them in at 2:30 and say "Who's hungry?"

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh. I'm fine. Thank you, though.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Do you want me to spin you in your chair and make you dizzy?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Why would I wanna do that?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: It's a thinking technique. All the top executives do it. It keeps the brain moving, and a spinning brain is a working brain.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: For now, I'm just gonna go back to work here...

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh sure.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah. Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Well.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [on phone] It will be a pleasure doing business with you. Thanks, bye. [hangs up phone, blows train whistle] I just got a new account for the gentleman's club in Carbondale. It is called "Curves." I went by there the other day, saw some of the women walking in. Not really my cup of tea. Actually, Kevin, you might like it!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Nice!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You know, we really don't announce out loud our sales that much.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why not? It's part of the sales experience.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's not really 1992 anymore.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, okay...

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [reading Andy's card] You brighten my day with the sound of your voice, you bring so much laughter and love, you're everything to me, and I was so blessed when God sent you here to me.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Geez louise.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I know, obsessed with me much?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Well, everyone got one.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: What did yours say?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Friends are worth sharing a doghouse with.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: It's no wonder that Andy gave Kelly such a romantic card. I can't compete with her. That girl can sing, and dance, and gets all of her clothes at the mall. And I feel like such a fool for thinking that Andy was only going after one girl, cause Andy Bernard is a playboy. And, why shouldn't he be? He's got it all.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ho-ho. There he is, the IT guy. So you discovered the break room.

Quote.Speaker: Nick
Quote.Text: Uh, yep.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I imagine one of the best things about being an IT guy is, you get to know everyone's computer passwords.

Quote.Speaker: Nick
Quote.Text: No, I actually don't.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Listen, I know you have to say that, but we got a little problem here. There is an employee named Jim Halpert, and he is doing some terrible things, okay? He is molesting people via the internet. And we need to stop him.

Quote.Speaker: Nick
Quote.Text: I think that you should call the cops.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, the cops called us. So I'm gonna need you to give me the password to Jim Halpert's computer.

Quote.Speaker: Nick
Quote.Text: I don't know what to tell you, man. I'm sorry, I just can't give out his password like that.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Nick. We could make things very, very difficult for you.

Quote.Speaker: Nick
Quote.Text: Are you... you threatening me?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Threatening you? No. [tries to crush an aluminum can, Dwight crushes an apple]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What is that smell? Do you smell that? What is that? Like a sulfur deposit under here?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael, stop.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, I'm serious, we don't have to put up... Is it the dogs?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what, we don't have to deal with this. I am going to Google sulfur maps.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael, it's Phyllis.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, this is geological.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I sent an email out to everyone in this area that this might be a side effect to my new allergy medication I'm on.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Are you kidding me?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And you guys are okay with this?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: She sent an email, so.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I did.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [has two tissues in his nostrils] It's not cause of the smell. I'm just expecting a nosebleed.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh my God.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Oh! You scared me!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I'm sorry, I thought you saw me.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I didn't see you. And you were there all along. [takes papers out of copy machine] Well, I warmed it up for you so, should be good to go.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Cool, thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Bye, Andy. [kisses his cheek]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: ...That was weird.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: No it ain't. We all saw the Valentine you gave her.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I don't even know what that card said.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Believe me, if I got that card? We'd be in the bathroom doin' it right... now.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know, it's funny. I used to stand in here and wish I was out there. Now I'm out there, and I wish I was in here.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, the grass is always greener.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah. Except there's no grass out there. It's just a farty dirt patch.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, it's what you wanted.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I really need my job back. We made a terrible mistake here.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: For the record, I fought this. Alright? And now, I'm not really sure what we do.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We make a poster that says "Happy Opposite Day!" and she sees it on the way out... Nah, that's stupid. Ugh! I wish we had one of those amnesia flashlights from Men in Black.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, what was that movie where their boss was within earshot and they could've just gone and talked to her.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Lethal Weapon?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's it. I think we should do it the Lethal Weapon way.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: You two are grown-ass men. What do I have to do, fire you and get two people in here who don't need so much management?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What? What I'm saying...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Michael's saying he's better at being manager, and I agree, cause he's a better people person, weirdly.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And weirdly I'm a good dog person, right guys? [dogs go to him] See? They love me.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Fine. I don't care which one of you does which job, just stop meeting with me to talk about it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright!

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: [cell phone rings] Oh, I gotta take this. Yep. Uh, finish walking my dogs for me. And don't ride 'em. Lotta people try to ride 'em.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [Erin leaves room] Excuse me? Everyone? Please check your emails, I just sent you the following message:

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yeah, I guess Andy never liked Kelly. How about that?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, it smells good in here.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Sure does! Okay, we have your space heater, your humidifier, your dehumidifier, your fan, your foot fan, and your food dehydrator.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Erin, what about my keyboard? [Erin hits a button on an electronic keyboard, playing a beat] Aw, so good to be home. How about a little Bosa Nova?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh! [hits another key, they awkwardly dance together]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [gesturing to Michael dancing in his office] He looks happy.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yep.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well, well, well. Hm. Boss for, what was it? Oh, four and a half hours? New record. Low. Previous record? Henry Rosston. Boss for nine years, four months. And he only left because he had family matters to attend to and he [Jim dunks Dwight's tie in his coffee cup, Pam smiles] what? Michael!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [entering elevator with Ryan] I can't help but think that something we did made this possible.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Jim dug his own grave, but maybe we provided the shovel.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh temp, I like that. I'm going to engrave that into a piece of wood. Care to celebrate with a drink?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I would love to. [elevator doors close, then reopen in the lobby] Why not?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Because! Martini bars are pretentious. No thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Well, I'm sorry that I don't want farm boy swill like you do, you know.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It is not "farm boy swill," I will show you. It is beet Vodka and it is delicious.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I am not interested in anything I have to make myself!
